page.title: 03PENRHYN BAY LITTLE ORME
page.content: {Pennrhyn Bay} lies at the foot of the {Little Orme} about a mile from the sea. A survey of the{residents}showed that most found it peaceful, safe, fairly clean and they liked living there. Fred has lived there for a long time and seen many changes. "Before the new houses were built it used to be a {farm.}I preferred the farm. I like seeing animals about rather than people. {Trams} used to run over the hill from Colwyn Bay to Llandudno West Shore. Some had no roof, called the { {Toastracks}- alright in nice weather but of course when it rained everybody got wet through. They stopped them after the war. They didn't pay."
